content.description: Start standing up and using the solid holds to work your way straight up the problem to a top out.
content.location: Once you arrive in the pit climbing area. There will be a big boulder immediately on your left. This is were the start to this problem is.

content.description: Stand up start, work your way straight up the boulder to a top out. Holds can be a little sharp and rough on the hands.
content.location: Walk directly into the pit climbing area and make a left for 10ft. The start to the problem will be directly on your right.

content.description: Start standing up directly behind the tree. Move up and then traverse left across the face to a top out.
content.location: The start is behind a large elm tree. The boulder is to the left of the trail leaving the pit area.

content.description: Start sitting down and work your way straight up the problem. Holds can be a little sandy and slippery.
content.location: When you arrive in The Pit make a left and the problem is on the back side of the boulder.

content.description: Start down low on the under hang. The crux is the big throw with the right, followed by another throw with your left.
content.location: Located on the backside of the pit climbing area. Once you leave the pit there will be a large boulder on your left side. The start is on the backside of it.

content.description: Sit down start, work your way up the boulder using pretty solid holds to a top out.
content.location: This problem is located as soon as you arrive into the Pit climbing area. It is the first boulder on your right.

content.description: Start standing up with a double under cling holds. Work your way right and then up to a top out.
content.location: Once you arrive in the pit via approach trail, the start is on the back side of the most centrally located boulder.

content.description: Start sitting down. The crux in this problem is the throw/dyno to the left handed sloper depending on how long you are. Once you get his move you will continue working your way up the boulder using some pretty decent holds.
content.location: The start to this problem is on the back side of the Pit climbing area to the left. Directly next to the Tecumseh problem.

content.description: Stand up start, work your way up to the right using a sloper and a crimp. Then a big throw to a nice hold. Continue to work your way up the boulder to a top out.
content.location: This problem is on the backside of the pit climbing area. Walk through the pit and immediately to the left you will see a large boulder. The start to this problem is on backside of it.

content.description: Start from the undercling pocket and crimp and make some big moves up to the jug for a fun mantle finish.
Start under the over hang and work yourself up. Once you get yourself up on the ledge work left and mantel to the top out.
content.location: Walk about 20 yards outside of the main Pit area. The start is on the backside of the large boulder on your left side.

content.description: Start on the right side of the face and traverse low cross the entire face. You can continue traversing around the entire boulder or you can climb up for a top out. Nice boulder to warm up on. Nice problem to work footwork.
content.location: Walk left out of the pit area and there will be a lone boulder about 20 yards on the left side of the trail.

content.description: Tricky start and first couple of moves. Traverse to the right and then up to an easier top out.
content.location: When you arrive in the main Pit bouldering, walk straight about 10 yards and the start is on the boulder on your right.

content.description: Stand up start then work your way up the route using a few crimps and mossy slopers to an easy top out.
content.location: Once arriving at The Pit bouldering area make a left and walk to the backside of the first boulder. The problem will be directly at that back of the rock.

content.description: Start standing up on the crimps. Then work your way up to the right. The crux is a big throw to a crimp.
content.location: The back side of the boulder on the left when entering The Pit.

content.description: Start low and work yourself up the right side of the wall to top out.
content.location: Located on the backside of the big boulder located in the center of the Pit area.

content.description: Lightly shaded and secluded area. The boulder problem are not the necessarily tall but they are fun. Rock is made of mostly sandstone.
